qas.question: What is the name of the solar powered car race held every two years?
What was the winner of the World Solar Challenge's average speed in 2007 in km/h?
What is The World Solar Challenge?
When was The World Solar Challenge started?
What was the average speed of a winning solar powered car in 1987?
What was the average speed of a winning solar powered car by 2007?
What are some other similar car races that use solar powered vehicles?

answers.text: The North American Solar Challenge and the planned South African Solar Challenge

context: Development of a solar-powered car has been an engineering goal since the 1980s. <a0_0>The World Solar Challenge<a0_0/> is <a2_0>a biannual solar-powered car race<a2_0/>, where teams from universities and enterprises compete over 3,021 kilometres (1,877 mi) across central Australia from Darwin to Adelaide. In <a3_0>1987<a3_0/>, when it was founded, the winner's average speed was <a4_0>67 kilometres per hour (42 mph)<a4_0/> and by 2007 the winner's average speed had improved to <a1_0><a5_0>90.87<a1_0/> kilometres per hour (56.46 mph)<a5_0/>. <a6_0>The North American Solar Challenge and the planned South African Solar Challenge<a6_0/> are comparable competitions that reflect an international interest in the engineering and development of solar powered vehicles.
